meanings.sent1: She decided to rebaptize her friend after they both learned more about their faith.
meanings.sent2: The pastor will rebaptize the new members of the church next Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The idea of rebaptizing the cat after it fell into the bathtub made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The rain was so refreshing, it felt like nature was rebaptizing the earth.
meanings.sent5: The act of rebaptizing symbolizes a fresh start and renewed commitment.

meanings.sent1: After some reflection, the priest decided to rebaptize the woman who had converted to the faith.
meanings.sent2: The missionary traveled to remote villages to rebaptize those who had not received a proper baptism.
meanings.sent3: The idea of rebaptizing the fish in the pond with a tiny water dropper seemed comical.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to rebaptize the world each morning, bringing new light and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The act of rebaptizing brings a sense of spiritual cleansing and renewal to the believers.

meanings.definition: The act of baptizing someone again.
meanings.sent1: The rebaptizing of the twins was a special ceremony for the family.
meanings.sent2: In some traditions, the rebaptizing of adults is a significant event in their spiritual journey.
meanings.sent3: The rebaptizing of the old car with a new coat of paint made it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: The rebaptizing of the garden with fresh rain brought life back to the wilting flowers.
meanings.sent5: The rebaptizing of a person signifies a reaffirmation of their faith and commitment.
